content.rendered:
MIRANDA BUCHANAN

PROGRAM DIRECTOR

CREDENTIALS
  • Bachelors in Business Management, Weber State University, Utah
  • Certified Human Resource Specialist
  • Associate Degree in Health Science, Weber State University, Utah
PROFESSIONAL

Miranda is passionate about caring for people and making them feel welcome. She is familiar with planning, implementing, and evaluating programs and projects and has experience running several organizational programs. Miranda enjoys working with the staff in helping to plan, execute, and successfully achieve their goals. Miranda completed the nursing program at Weber State University, and soon after transitioning into this role decided to pursue her education in business management. Miranda is currently completing her Masters Degree in Business Management at Western Governors University.

PERSONAL

Miranda was born and raised in Davis County and now resides near Bridge House in Farmington, Utah. She loves to spend her free time adventuring outdoors with her son and husband, watching movies, and baking. She enjoys exercise and health and loves to be around people and involved in her community.

HOPE, HEALTH & HEALING

Miranda believes that hope is an integral part of healing, as it will help motivate behavior in the presence of obstacles and challenges. She believes that the power of healthy, meaningful, and positive relationships can help those in the healing process. Healing is a transformative journey, and is a gradual process that requires patience and self-compassion. Miranda believes that hope, health, and healing are intertwined aspects of our human experience.

Working in mental health since 2014

Working at Bridge House since 2017
